resources.string:
2014 was a breakthrough with the launch of TEXEPHYR-technical festival organized by the students of Maharashtra institute of technology, Pune with the aim to celebrate technology and innovation. 

Texephyr is an amalgamation of two words-Technology and Zephyr. It signifies the change brought upon by innovative minds. Texephyr’14 was based on ‘CONQUERING HORIZONS’ which signified the method by which today’s technology is advancing and it represented imagination and willpower to reach the unreached.

Texephyr’15 supported the theme ‘SWACHH BHARAT TECHNOLOGY ’, which signified the departure of something that is prevalent and pursuing the unaccomplished with the help of cutting-edge technology and innovation.

Texephyr’16 promoted the age of digitization and ensured creation of digital infrastructure for delivering services digitally and increased digital literacy.

In today’s world, everyone is surrounded by smartphone and smart gadgets.Taking cue from the same, Texephyr’17 is committed to smart city-a new and bold initiative by government of India to drive economic growth by harnessing technology that leads to smart outcomes. Embarking upon the idea, team has many ideas to implement the same notation. Our Prime Minister NARENDRA MODI is the greatest influence behind the smart city initiative.

The festival consist of a plentitude of technical ,non-technical ,managerial and entertainment based events that challenge the imagination ,wit and creativity of the students. Apart from this, the team understands its responsibility towards the society.In 2016 supported by two NGOs, make a difference and Bookwallah, Texephyr celebrated joy of giving ,a week long social cause campaign.

The basic idea was to assuage the plight of underprivileged kids in our society .More than 100 kgs of material was distributed among kids at S.O.S, Yerwada. Texephyr also supported Tahann, an initiative with the mission to quench the thirst of thousands of people in Baramati, by providing water tankers during the drought period in May, 2016.

The current year comes again as an opportunity for the team Texephyr to prove its mettle and scale greater heights in technical as well as social domain.
"Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."

string-array.name: BrainstormingDescriptions
string-array.item: Everyone watches Tom and Jerry, in which Jerry throws a small ball and eventually a bomb blasts over Tom\'s head. Thus Jerry\'s mission is accomplished. Same concept applies here. You have to achieve the final result (as given in the problem statement) in the most fascinating and peculiar way possible.

For all those who want to see their ideas stand up tall! This event is a perfect blend of acknowledgement and analyzation of a concept. The event will mainly test your knowledge of the subjects namely SOM and applied mechanics. The final round will be based on model making.

Ready to rack your brains and take puzzles and tricky questions head-on? Brain Booster is the right platform for you. Explore the many realms of non-technical reasoning that is at the heart of all campus recruitments!
Flaunt your electronic skills Designing the circuits at your disposal.
Algoholics, as the name suggests, is an algorithm based event which tests your logical thinking rather than testing your coding abilities. The motto of the event is Think efficient, build efficient.

string-array.name: CodingDescriptions
string-array.item: For all the coders out there, TEXEPHYR brings Code storm. Write out the optimised and most efficient code to prove your coding prowess. This event will not only test your coding but also evaluate your debugging.

Let\'s find out who\'s the ultimate coder. To claim the title, coders will have to survive three rounds, that will check your coding abilities across various situations. These rounds are Djigksaw Puzzle, Qwearky Code and Blind Coding
Team up with your partner and write the code for a problem that we give you, just not together! Read and complete the code turn by turn when you get the chance to sit on the computer.
Hand drafting?! Nah! Here’s something more exciting. If you like working with a software for designing (modeling), this event is the right choice.

string-array.name: NonTechDescriptions
string-array.item: Need for Speed, also known by its initials NFS, is a racing video game franchise published by Electronic Arts and developed by several studios including EA Black Box, Criterion Games and Ghost Games.

Counter-Strike (officially abbreviated as CS) is a series of multiplayer first-person shooter video games, in which teams of terrorists and counter-terrorists battle to, respectively, perpetrate an act of terror (bombing, hostage-taking) and prevent it (bomb defusal, hostage rescue).
Defense of the Ancients (DotA) is a multiplayer online battle arena(MOBA), the first of its kind. DOTA has over 12 million active monthly users.
FIFA, also known as FIFA Football or FIFA Soccer, is a series of association football video games or football simulator.
Try your hand at chess in this fun chess tournament! Compete with other players and win the most number of rounds to become the ultimate chess champion.

Rubik\'s Cube is a 3-D combination puzzle invented in 1974 by Hungarian sculptor and professor of architecture Ernő Rubik. Originally called the Magic Cube, the puzzle was licensed by Rubik to be sold by Ideal Toy Corp.
For all the pographers out there! This is a fun event where you can go around capturing moments.

Here\'s a chance to showcase your skills as a player in the ever so exciting game Mini Militia. Team up with 3 other players and compete on your mobile to beat the opponent teams on your way to glory!
If you are well updated with things and events happening around, roll in for this event and test your own reach!
A different version of the most loved game in our country. Make a team of 7 (5+2) and off you go!! And of course get a prize on winning!
Here’s a new way to play football! All you need is a team of 5(3+2) so join in and win prizes

string-array.name: RobotsDescriptions
string-array.item: Yes, An actual battle!! Just as cool as it sounds. Fight the other team’s bot with all the great techniques and be the champion.\n\n
The machine (bot) should navigate the track in minimum possible time by clearing all obstacles and checkpoints.\n\n
For all those who believe in setting the place on fire! Here’s a live experience of a racing tournament.

The objective of this contest is for a robot to follow a black line on a white background, without losing the line. The robot to complete the course in the shortest period of time while accurately tracking the course line from start to finish wins.

MIT Pune and IDRL have collaborated to bring you Maharashtra’s first league drone race at Texephyr 2017! Pilots from all over the nation will be arriving with custom built racing drones to fly as fast as they can in order to take the prizes home.

string-array.name: FunWithTechDescriptions
string-array.item: Do you know your PC? Find the right parts and assemble the PC in 30 minutes. Teamwork is everything to win this war. The competition is designed for students to display skills in PC assembly with great precision and speed. Students will demonstrate their ability to put together a PC from junk parts until it has started to successfully boot.
Think of Google as your best friend? Lets see if it helps you find the answers to the not-so-easy questions we give you!
Test your knowledge about Windows when we quiz you about the shortcuts and assign you a task to be completed without using the mouse.

Always wanted to experience how an interview feels like? Answer some personal and social questions and get a chance to sit for an interview to be judged based on your personality. Also, get the copy of your interview!

string-array.name: WorkshopNames
string-array.item: Paradigm Shift in Technology Landscape - An IOT Perspective

string-array.name: WorkshopDescriptions
string-array.item:
With over one billion devices activated, Android is an exciting space to make apps to help you communicate, organize, educate, entertain or anything else you’re passionate about.

It's the largest installed base of any mobile platform and growing fast—every day another million users power up their Android devices for the first time and start looking for apps,games, and other digital content. Android gives you a world-class platform for creating apps and games for Android users everywhere, as well as an open marketplace for distributing to them instantly. This workshop Powered by GeeksLAB is focused to give the overview of Android and explore its building blocks.

Learn to develop applications in the latest operating system with practical implementation and begin managing your own cool applications like a professional at this workshop. Attendees will be provided with instructions to build and manage new cool applications. What's more, you can even sell out these applications and earn good money!!

This program is conceptualized to impart an industrial work flow to students, that how automobile components function, how vehicle is conceptualized, designed and manufactured. This program provides a platform to the students which supports their engineering thoughts to give them a pragmatic experience.

3D Printing is an Additive Manufacturing technique that creates a physical object from a virtual 3D CAD model by depositing successive layers of material. They work like the traditional inkjet printers, but instead of ink ,a 3D printer deposits desired material to manufacture an object .
